intro: Hieracium constrictiforme, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium constrictiforme is also known for its ability to spread through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in agricultural settings.
